meanings.definition: The underside of a person's foot.
meanings.sent1: She felt the sand between her toes and the rough texture of her soles.
meanings.sent2: He always made sure to wear comfortable shoes that supported his soles during long walks.
meanings.sent3: As she walked on the hot pavement, she wished she had tiny fans under her soles to keep them cool.
meanings.sent4: His soles were like the foundation of a building, providing stability and balance to his entire body.
meanings.sent5: The reflexologist applied pressure to specific points on her soles to promote relaxation and well-being.

meanings.definition: The bottom part of a shoe or boot.
meanings.sent1: The soles of his sneakers were worn out from all the running he did.
meanings.sent2: She carefully inspected the soles of the new boots to ensure they were sturdy and durable.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the soles of his shoes were so thick, he could walk on hot coals without feeling a thing.
meanings.sent4: The soles of the hiking boots gripped the rocky terrain like a mountain goat's hooves.
meanings.sent5: The cobbler expertly replaced the worn-out soles of the old shoes, making them look brand new again.

meanings.definition: The flatfish of the family Soleidae.
meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a delicious dish using fresh soles caught that morning.
meanings.sent2: The market had a special on soles, so she decided to try cooking them for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The soles on his plate were cooked to perfection, flaky and flavorful.
meanings.sent4: The soles swam gracefully in the aquarium, their flat bodies blending in with the sandy bottom.
meanings.sent5: She marveled at the intricate patterns on the soles' scales, shimmering in the sunlight.
